CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 16, 1961, pg. A27, reads: "TOMMY SMITHS EYE TITLE - The crack Tommy Smith team, winner of Section 2 honors in Ammon Slow Pitch League, remains tied with Broadway in the best two-out-of-three series in the playoffs for the right to meet the Porkys. Section I titlist, for the league championship, following Wednesday's game on the Ammon Field.  The Smiths were leading, 12-10, when darkness halted the game.  The deciding tilt will be played Monday.  First row, left to right are: H. Holt, right field; Pete Matthews, pitcher; N. Conley, first base; L. Stein, utility infielder; E. Terry, left fielder; T. Watkins, catcher, and front Wesley Connors, batboy.  Second row, same order: W. Austin, right short; J. Younger, shortstop; E. Smalley, manager; J. Smith, center fielder; B. Johnson, utility fielder; S. Lewis, second base; R. Lewis second-string catcher; Richard Lewis, third base, and Fifth Ward Constable Tommy Smith, sponsor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Tommy Smith softball team, with batboy Wesley Connors squatting in center; first row from left: Harry Holt, Pete Matthews, N. Conley, L. Stein, E. Terry, Tom Watkins; second row: W. Austin, Jackie Younger, E. Smalley, J. Smith, B. Johnson, S. Lewis, R. Lewis, Richard Lewis, and Fifth Ward Constable and sponsor Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith, posed on Ammon playing field
